CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG of PERSON ( the “ ORG ” ) against ORG , seeking the recovery of salary arrears .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court found for the applicant and ordered the entity to pay him ORG CARDINAL ( around CARDINAL euros – “ EUR ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE GPE of PERSON instituted enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the judgment was not enforced due to the large number of enforcement proceedings against the debtor and its lack of funds .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG applied to ORG to have the debtor in the enforcement proceedings replaced , as the latter ’s property had been transferred to ORG ( the “ DHME ” ) pursuant to the decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court granted the request of ORG and ruled that the ORG was responsible for the payment of the judgment debt of DATE to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG transferred the amount of the award to the deposit account of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the applicant to provide them with his bank account details in order that they transfer the amount of the award .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the applicant failed to provide the Bailiffs with the information requested .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not contest this submission .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
